item.title: Jim add a quote by Richard Feynmann
item.description: "Study hard what interests you the most in the most undisciplined, irreverent and original manner possible." -- Richard Feynmann

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "Forget safety. Live where you fear to live. Destroy your reputation. Be notorious." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never be haughty to the humble, never be humble to the haughty." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The intuitive mind is a sacred gift and the rational mind is a faithful servant. We have created a society that honors the servant and has forgotten the gift." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "When we think of friends, and call their faces out of the shadows, and their voices out of the echoes that faint along the corridors of memory, and do it without knowing why save that we love to do it, we content ourselves that that friendship is a Reality, and not a Fancy--that it is builded upon a rock, and not upon the sands that dissolve away with the ebbing tides and carry their monuments with them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Jim add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "I have no objection to any person's religion, be it what it may, so long as that person does not kill or insult any other person, because that other person don't believe it also. But when a man's religion becomes really frantic; when it is a positive torment to him; and, in fine, makes this earth of ours an uncomfortable inn to lodge in; then I think it high time to take that individual aside and argue the point with him." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Jim add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Love is a better master than duty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jim add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "The trouble is that we have a bad habit, encouraged by pendants and sophisticates, of considering happiness as something rather stupid. Only pain is intellectual, only evil interesting. This is the treason of the artist: a refusal to admit the banality of evil and the terrible boredom of pain." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Jim add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "We read books to find out who we are. What other people, real or imaginary, do and think and feel... is an essential guide to our understanding of what we ourselves are and may become." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Life is short, Break the Rules. Forgive quickly, Kiss SLOWLY. Love truly. Laugh uncontrollably And never regret ANYTHING That makes you smile." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There are many humorous things in the world; among them, the white man's notion that he is less savage than the other savages." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In the beginning of a change the patriot is a scarce man, and brave, and hated and scorned. When his cause succeeds, the timid join him, for then it costs nothing to be a patriot." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Man is the only animal that blushes. Or needs to." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have found out that there ain't no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "When you fish for love, bait with your heart, not your brain." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Patriotism is supporting your country all the time and your government when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Humor is mankind's greatest blessing." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A half-truth is the most cowardly of lies." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Drag your thoughts away from your troubles... by the ears, by the heels, or any other way you can manage it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The secret source of humor is not joy but sorrow; there is no humor in heaven." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There has never been a just [war], never an honorable one--on the part of the instigator of the war. I can see a million years ahead, and this rule will never change in so many as half a dozen instances. The loud little handful--as usual--will shout for the war. The pulpit will--warily and cautiously--object--at first; the great, big, dull bulk of the nation will rub its sleepy eyes and try to make out why there should be a war, and will say, earnestly and indignantly, 'It is unjust and dishonorable, and there is no necessity for it.' Then the handful will shout louder. A few fair men on the other side will argue and reason against the war with speech and pen, and at first will have a hearing and be applauded; but it will not last long; those others will outshout them, and presently the anti-war audiences will thin out and lose popularity. Before long you will see this curious thing: the speakers stoned from the platform, and free speech strangled by hordes of furious men who in their secret hearts are still at one with those stoned speakers--as earlier--but do not dare say so. And now the whole nation--pulpit and all--will take up the war-cry, and shout itself hoarse, and mob any honest man who ventures to open his mouth; and presently such mouths will cease to open. Next the statesmen will invent cheap lies, putting the blame upon the nation that is attacked, and every man will be glad of those conscience-soothing falsities, and will diligently study them, and refuse to examine any refutations of them; and thus he will by and by convince himself the war is just, and will thank God for the better sleep he enjoys after this process of grotesque self-deception." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "great people are those who make others feel that they, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jim add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I believe that everything happens for a reason. People change so that you can learn to let go, things go wrong so that you appreciate them when they're right, you believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself, and sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Jim add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein
